item.title: Fourth milestone: We Have a Firewall!
item.description:
Igalian Asumu Takikawa has completed the next development milestone of SnabbWall. This means that the L7fw application is now available, as well as a snabb wall filter command, which can be readily used. With these additions, the fourth development milestone of our development roadmap is now completed. Make sure to check out Asumu’s complete writeup about the new features.

We have also started using the project wiki to write down some technical information for developers wanting to use the SnabbWall components in their Snabb applications, or looking into contributing to the project.

item.title: Third milestone: SnabbWall can now analyze traffic
item.description:
After a small hiatus, work on SnabbWall is progressing steadily again: the L7Spy Snabb application and the snabb wall spy command, which can be used to scan network traffic and detect L7 data flows, have landed in the repository. Our main developer has written a lengthy post about these features, which completes the third milestone of the development roadmap.

The ljndpi FFI binding has received updates as well. Starting with version 0.0.3, it can be used with nDPI 1.8; and in order to ease adoption of ljndpi by projects other than SnabbWall, the module has been uploaded to the LuaRocks repository. For more details, you can read Adrián’s article on this topic.

item.title: Development reaches second milestone
item.description: The first release of ljndpi, our binding for the nDPI deep packet inspection library, marks the completion of the second milestone of the SnabbWall development roadmap. Our lead developer has written an article explaning how it was implemented.

item.title: Introducing SnabbWall
item.description: The project is officially started! Adrián Pérez has posted a writeup introducing the project and commenting on some of aspects of the design of SnabbWall.
